intro: Tarigidia, commonly known as the common tarweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical heads. The plant is native to North America and thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows and disturbed soils. Tarigidia has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
